name: RetrieveTimeClockEvents
description:
Retrieve time clock events based on worker and date range.

This tool retrieves a collection of time clock events from Workday. It allows filtering by worker and a specific date range to provide the relevant time tracking data.

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: The start date for the time event in yyyy-mm-dd format.

value_schema.description: The start date of the time event using the yyyy-mm-dd format.

parameters.name: maximum_objects_per_response
parameters.description: Specify the maximum number of time clock event records to return in a single response. Accepts an integer between 1 and 100, with a default of 20.

value_schema.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

parameters.name: collection_start_index
parameters.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response. Default is 0. Use with limit to manage pagination.

value_schema.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: The end date of the time event in yyyy-mm-dd format.

value_schema.description: The end date of the time event using the yyyy-mm-dd format.

parameters.name: worker_ids
parameters.description: An array of Workday IDs for workers related to the time block or clock event. Allows multiple IDs for querying multiple workers.

value_schema.description: The Workday ID of the worker for the time block or clock event. You can specify multiple worker query parameters.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the Workday API

parameters.name: fromDate
parameters.description: The start date of the time event using the yyyy-mm-dd format.

value_schema.description: The start date of the time event using the yyyy-mm-dd format.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

value_schema.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

value_schema.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

parameters.name: toDate
parameters.description: The end date of the time event using the yyyy-mm-dd format.

value_schema.description: The end date of the time event using the yyyy-mm-dd format.

parameters.name: worker
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the worker for the time block or clock event. You can specify multiple worker query parameters.

value_schema.description: The Workday ID of the worker for the time block or clock event. You can specify multiple worker query parameters.

secrets.description: The OAuth token to use for authentication.
